timeline.message:
ref #310 - Set UtcTimestampPrecision in generator

Added support for setting a default UtcTimestampPrecision in the
quickfixj-codegenerator Maven plugin. The default applies to the
following classes and their generated sub classes.
- UtcTimeField
- UtcTimeOnlyField
- UtcTimeStampField

timeline.bodyText: Trivial: I think it should be "are".
timeline.author: the-thing

timeline.bodyText: Not sure how often this method is used, but this does not seem correct.
timeline.author: the-thing

replies.bodyText: Hi @the-thing. Can you please elaborate? I did not understand what is wrong here.
replies.author: simenflatby

replies.bodyText: Aren't you reassining the same field task.utcTimestampPrecision = task.utcTimestampPrecision?
replies.author: the-thing

replies.bodyText: Ah, I see now that this looks stupid😂. Sets the value to it self... I'm not familiar with the usage of this main method, so maybe one of you could suggest a solution?
replies.author: simenflatby

replies.bodyText: I believe this methods is used when you want to run code generation locally from IDE etc.. I would follow the same pattern as e.g. overwrite/orderedFields/useDecimal. Create an option, get an option or default value, set it.
replies.author: the-thing

replies.bodyText: OK. Thank you. I will have a look at it.
replies.author: simenflatby

replies.bodyText: Suggestion in e1b5bee. Created the getOption(String key, String defaultValue) in case someone want to change the default value to something other than null later. I will check back to see if you have any feedback tomorrow.
replies.author: simenflatby

timeline.message:
ref #310 - Removes excess empty lines

Removes excess empty lines from generated files

ref #310 - Don't use ctor with precision

It is not nesesary to use the constructor with
UtcTimestampPrecision. It is set as a default anyways.

ref #310 - Set precision in main

When running main method, Set utcTimestampPrecision to value from
property "generator.utcTimestampPrecision", otherwise null.
